review: I used TiVo until I added "Boost" to my wireless and couldn't get TiVo box to work anymore. I switched to this and LOVE IT.I don't have that monthly fee for Tivo. I can watch almost everything I now get on Cable on either Hulu Plus or Netflix. It was super-easy to just plug it in (don't forget to buy the cable that connects from the Apple box to your TV cause it doesn't come with the Apple TV box). A child could set this up, its that easy.Crystal clear TV also, oddly sharper than when I watch cable on my HD TV's. I don't know why that is.I'm going to use this for a week and figure out which cable stations I no longer want, then save some $$ on my cable bill.Buy it, you won't regret it.
author: Anne Cohen "Dramatic Soprano"

review: I purchased the Apple TV 3 days before the announcement that Apple had planned on silently releasing a new version of the Apple TV 3, currently being called 3,2 (designated model 1469). This information was discovered when Apple filed with the FCC regarding a newer device. The (4mm) smaller Apple TV will have the A5X chip and new low-power dual-band 40nm Broadcom BCM4334 chip that is present in new iDevices like the iPhone 5. This is not a major upgrade, and the average user will not notice a difference. However, I would rather wait a few more weeks and purchase the newest device available.
